Bag O' Links - 23/4/2009

  • RailsKits – Skeleton applications with some specific functionality to get you started in the right direction.
  • RubyGems 1.3.2 plugin support – it appears that now you can add some more functionality to your gem minion.
  • Table design screencast – helpful.. too bad not all available tweaks are there.
  • Background Generators – nice.
  • Passenger Pane for MacOS – Run and manage passenger on your MacOS dev machine, i really hope that this is the beginning of the end for Mongrel.
  • Array iteration in Javascript – So many path to choose from..
  • Help elements – i tend to use them only on validation errors, but maybe i’ll reconsider it in the future.
